title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
3 Points

One point is earned for connecting bulbs A,B, and C end to end, in the correct order

One point is earned for connecting bulb D in parallel across both B and C

One point is earned for connecting the battery so that current exists in all for bulbs
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

One point is earned for connecting bulbs A,B, and C end to end, in the correct order

One point is earned for connecting bulb D in parallel across both B and C

One point is earned for connecting the battery so that current exists in all for bulbs

The student earns one of the following points:

One point is earned for connecting bulbs A,B, and C end to end, in the correct order

One point is earned for connecting bulb D in parallel across both B and C

One point is earned for connecting the battery so that current exists in all for bulbs

The student earns two of the following points:

One point is earned for connecting bulbs A,B, and C end to end, in the correct order

One point is earned for connecting bulb D in parallel across both B and C

One point is earned for connecting the battery so that current exists in all for bulbs

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned for connecting bulbs A,B, and C end to end, in the correct order

One point is earned for connecting bulb D in parallel across both B and C

One point is earned for connecting the battery so that current exists in all for bulbs

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
3 Points

One point is earned for indicating that bulb A is brightest, and bulb D is brighter than both bulb B and C

One point is earned for indicating that bulbs B and C have the same brightness

One point is earned for correct justifications.

For example, bulb A has the largest current through it, making it brightest. The voltage across bulb D is the same as that across bulbs B and C combined, so it is next brightest, leaving B and C as least bright. Bulbs B and C are in series, and thus have the same current through them, so they must be equally bright.

title: Part C - 1
stimulusHtml:
2 Points

One point is earned for indicating that the brightness of bulb A decreases

One point is earned for correct justification.
For example: The total resistance of the circuit increases, so the current in bulb A decreases.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points.

One point is earned for indicating that the brightness of bulb A decreases

One point is earned for correct justification.
For example: The total resistance of the circuit increases, so the current in bulb A decreases.

title: Part C - 2
stimulusHtml:
2 Points

One point is earned for indicating that the brightness of bulb B increases

One point is earned for a correct justification.
For example: The current in bulb B increases, or the voltage across it increases.
